column4: hey guys i get an error: no such partition.  Grub rescue>    on boot up. any ideas how i can remove grum from the cmd line?
*sorry remove grub from the cmd line..
remove and do what?
your question make no sense, without a what is happening and whats the goal.
windows will install grub prompt or not a cd or dvd boots before the grub>     You answer is a dichotomy install or fix what s it.;)

sorry full story is this.. I had a duel boot sys. win7 and ubuntu. friend decided to remove win7 and put on win xp, but he just deleted all the partitions in win7 partition manager and now all i get is grub prompt..
if i install win i get the same error. so i cannot boot it
so you have a wiped HD and a disc to install windows?
correct
grub is not the problem is the disc not booting when the bios is set to read the disc befor the hd?
one thing. i only have a win7 recovery disk. the disk boots and installs win correctly but on rebooti get that error..
i have no options in the recovery disk to do anything to the partitions.
a recovery disc is only f=good if you have a image for it to install.
the f=good was a typo sorry
the image installs alright but it will not boot. it goes back to grub.
im guessing it doesnt change the mbr?
run the recovery disc to tthe language choose it then hit r go to the command line and run bootrec.exe /fixmbr
il give that a go.. 2 min :)
that should reload the mbr for you and wipe grub out.
cheers mate that worked nicely...
cool
